sections.title: I am the Lord your God; you shall not have strange gods before me

questions.text: Have I prioritized God above all else in my family life?
Have I taught my children to know, love, and serve God?
Have I led by example in prayer, worship, and faithfulness?
Have I trusted God during times of hardship or fear?
Have I placed success, work, or comfort above my vocation?
Have I encouraged my children to trust in God’s will?
Have I sought God's will before making major decisions?

sections.title: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain

questions.text: Have I used God’s name with reverence and respect?
Have I corrected disrespectful language about God in my home?
Have I kept my promises and spoken truthfully?
Have I prayed sincerely and without distraction?
Have I used holy things (scripture, sacraments) with reverence?
Have I avoided using God’s name casually or angrily?
Have I helped my children understand reverence for God?

sections.title: Remember to keep holy the Lord’s Day

questions.text: Have I made Sunday a day of worship and rest for my family?
Have I prioritized Mass attendance and reverence?
Have I avoided unnecessary work or errands on Sunday?
Have I encouraged my family to rest, reflect, and reconnect?
Have I prepared for Sunday as a sacred day?
Have I used Sunday to teach the faith and bond with my children?
Have I honored the Lord’s Day even in busy seasons?

sections.title: Honor your father and your mother

questions.text: Have I honored my own parents and in-laws with love?
Have I taught my children to respect their elders?
Have I supported my parents when they needed me?
Have I spoken respectfully of authority figures?
Have I modeled obedience and humility toward God’s authority?
Have I forgiven past wounds in family relationships?
Have I expressed gratitude for my family heritage?
Have I controlled my temper with my wife and children?
Have I avoided words or actions that wound or shame?
Have I created a safe, peaceful home for my family?
Have I shown mercy instead of resentment?
Have I protected life from conception to natural death?
Have I encouraged my children to be peacemakers?
Have I asked forgiveness for past anger or emotional harm?
Have I remained faithful to my wife in body and in thought?
Have I rejected impure media, entertainment, or fantasies?
Have I modeled chastity, purity, and self-control?
Have I avoided friendships or habits that lead to temptation?
Have I nurtured intimacy with my wife through love and trust?
Have I taught my children to honor their bodies and others’?
Have I confessed and repented of any impurity?
Have I been honest and fair in work and finances?
Have I modeled stewardship and integrity for my children?
Have I paid fair wages and kept financial promises?
Have I used family resources responsibly?
Have I avoided waste and practiced generosity?
Have I respected others’ time, space, and property?
Have I returned what I borrowed or corrected wrongs?

sections.title: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor

questions.text: Have I spoken truthfully and with charity in all things?
Have I avoided gossip, slander, and harsh judgment?
Have I taught my children the value of honesty and integrity?
Have I corrected misunderstandings with humility?
Have I defended the reputation of those wrongly judged?
Have I apologized when I spoke unjustly?
Have I been a trustworthy example for my children?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife

questions.text: Have I looked at others with lust or compared them to my wife?
Have I fostered gratitude for my wife’s presence and gifts?
Have I guarded my heart from romantic or emotional temptation?
Have I modeled fidelity and reverence for marriage?
Have I spoken well of my wife publicly and privately?
Have I avoided anything that might damage our intimacy?
Have I prayed to love my wife as Christ loves the Church?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods

questions.text: Have I compared our possessions or income with others?
Have I modeled contentment and gratitude for my family?
Have I pressured my family to acquire more than we need?
Have I prioritized relationships over material gain?
Have I avoided materialism and status-seeking?
Have I supported the Church and charitable causes generously?
Have I taught my children to be grateful and generous?
